aggregation.text: The way to aggregate the analytics. Possible values are all (aggregate all data together), year (aggregate data on a yearly basis), month (aggregate data on a yearly basis), week (aggregate data on a yearly basis), day (aggregate data on a yearly basis), or hour (aggregate data on an hourly basis, limited to a time_range 7 days or less).

time_range[start].text: The start date of the aggregation period. The value of this property should be a string in the format yyyy-mm-dd according to ISO 8601.

time_range[end].text: The end date of the aggregation period. The value of this property should be a string in the format yyyy-mm-dd according to ISO 8601.

metrics[].text: The metrics that you want to fetch data for

media_variants[].text: The media variants to fetch data for

meta.description: Get the player settings for your project

project_id.text: The numeric ID of your project

player_version.text: The player version to use. Possible values are 0 for legacy and 1 for the current

player_style.text: he style of user interface to show for the player. Possible values are small, standard, large, or video

player_title.text: The title to show in the large player when there isn't a playlist

call_to_action.text: The text prompt to show on the player

image_url.text: An image to show in the player instead of the content's image

persistent_ad_image.text: Whether to show clickable ad images in the player when the ad isn't playing

theme.text: The color theme to use for the player. The color theme to use for the player. Possible values are auto, dark, or light

text_color.text: The hexadecimal text color to use in the player

background_color.text: The hexadecimal background color to use in the player

icon_color.text: The hexadecimal icon color to use in the player

highlight_color.text: The hexadecimal highlight color to use in the playerd

text_color.text: The hexadecimal text color to use in the player

background_color.text: The hexadecimal background color to use in the player

icon_color.text: The hexadecimal icon color to use in the player

highlight_color.text: The hexadecimal highlight color to use in the playerd

text_color.text: The hexadecimal text color to use in the player

background_color.text: The hexadecimal background color to use in the player

icon_color.text: The hexadecimal icon color to use in the player

highlight_color.text: The hexadecimal highlight color to use in the playerd

title_enabled.text: Whether to always show the content's title (e.g. instead of the call_to_action)

image_enabled.text: Whether to show or hide the image in the player

widget_style.text: The style of user interface to show for the widget at the bottom of the screen. Possible values are none, small, standard, large, video The widget appears once you scroll past the player in the page.

widget_position.text: The side of the screen on which to show the widget. Possible values are auto, left, center, right The 'auto' position places the standard player in the center, otherwise to the right.

segment_playback_enabled.text: Whether to allow playback by clicking on a segment (i.e. a paragraph) on the page Support for this depends on adding some markup into the HTML of the page.

skip_button_style.text: The style of skip buttons to show in the player. Possible values are auto, segments, seconds or audios You can specify the number of seconds to skip, e.g. seconds-15 or seconds-15-30 The auto style uses audios if there is a playlist and segments otherwise.

intro_url.text: The URL of an intro audio file to play before all content in the player

outro_url.text: The URL of an outro audio file to play after all content in the player.

intro_outro_enabled.text: Whether or not the intro and outro should be played. The default is false

paywall_type.text: The style of paywall to apply to the player. Possible values are none, show, hide or lock You can specify the number of body segments to make listenable, e.g. show-3

paywall_url.text: The URL to link to when the content is paywalled, e.g. a signup page

download_button_enabled.text: Whether to show a download button next to each playlist item in the player

share_button_enabled.text: Whether to show a share button in the player

voice_icon_enabled.text: Whether to show an icon stating that the voice was AI generated in the player

logo_icon_enabled.text: Whether to show the BeyondWords logo in the player

project_id.text: The numeric ID of your project

meta.description: User should be able to list all RSS feeds.

project_id.text: The numeric ID of your project

enabled.text: Whether importing is enabled or disabled.

feed_url.text: URL of the RSS feed you want to import.

feed_content_type.text: Type of content in the feed. Possible values include xml or json.

feed_headers.text: Headers that you want to include in the HTTP request when fetching the RSS feed.

import_interval.text: Number of minutes between each import of the RSS feed.

extractor_enabled.text: Whether or not the RSS importer should fetch the content from the page linked in the map.source_url property. Set to true if the RSS feed does not contain the content. In this case you can set map.body to null.

extractor_headers.text: Headers that you want to include in the HTTP request when fetching and extracting the content from the map.source_url.

title.text: Array of strings that represent the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the title of the feed item.

body.text: Array of strings that represent the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the content of the feed item. If extractor_enabled is true then the RSS importer will open the URL in the map.source_url and extract the content from the page.

summary.text: Array of strings that represent the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the summary of the feed item.

source_id.text: String that represents the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the id of the feed item.

source_url.text: String that represents the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the URL of the feed item.

author.text: String that represents the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the author of the feed item.

metadata.text: String that represents the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the metadata of the feed item.

image_url.text: String that represents the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the image header of the feed item.

publish_date.text: String that represents the name of the element in the RSS feed that corresponds to the pubDate of the feed item.

map.text: Object that contains mappings between the data in the RSS feed and the properties in the content object. Each property in the map object represents a property in the content object, and its value is a string that represents the name of the corresponding element in the RSS feed.

project_id.text: The numeric ID of your project

meta.description: Get the video settings for your project

project_id.text: The numeric ID of your project

enabled.text: Whether text-to-speech videos should be generated for the project.

logo_image_url.text: The logo that should appear in the corner of the video. Defaults to the BeyondWords logo.

logo_image_position.text: The position of the logo that appears in the corner of the video.

background_color.text: The background color of the video when there is no image. Supports CSS colors including linear-gradient(to right, ...)

text_background_color.text: The background color to show behind text. Supports CSS colors including linear-gradient(to right, ...)

text_color.text: The foreground color of text. Supports CSS colors including linear-gradient(to right, ...)

text_highlight_color.text: The foreground color of text whilst the word is being read out. Supports CSS colors including linear-gradient(to right, ...)

waveform_color.text: The color of the audio waveform bars. Supports CSS colors including linear-gradient(to right, ...)

content_image_enabled.text: Whether to show the content's image_url as the default background image.

image_extraction_enabled.text: Whether to extract images by default from HTML content. Alternatively, set the data-beyondwords-image='true' attribute.

pan_and_zoom_enabled.text: Whether to automatically pan and zoom images in generated videos.

project_id.text: The numeric ID of your project

meta.description: Update the video settings for your project

pagination[limit].text: 'limit' sets the number of results to return in each page.

pagination[offset].text: 'offset' sets the first position to return from the results of the query. The default is 0, which starts the page at the first result.

order[by].text: This is used to order voice issues by created time

order[dir].text: This is used to order analytics in the ascending or descending order

meta.description: Lists voice issues in a organization.

label.text: The voice issue label. Possible values are incorrect_pronunciation, incorrect_lexical_stress, incorrect_heteronym, incorrect_language, incorrect_intonation, incorrect_spoken_format, incorrect_pausing, incorrect_speed, text_missing_or_added, audio_issue

id.text: Project id
Content id

id.text: id

speaking_rate.text: The speaking rate for this voice as a percentage. Ranges from 50 to 200, where 100 is default speed, 50 is half speed, and 200 is double speed.
